title: Skin Trade
description: After his family is killed by a Serbian gangster with international interests. NYC detective Nick goes to S.E. Asia and teams up with a Thai detective to get revenge and destroy the syndicates human trafficking network.

reviews.text: The action is great, and the film has a solid cast as well. But, Skin Trade isn't as good as I thought it would be. The story, which revolves around cops fighting the horrific human trafficking, is bare bones, cheesy and wafer thin. Notably, Ron Perlman as Viktor Dragovic was the only reason Skin Trade excels on the villain side of things. Overall, it has the guts to be a big budget sellout, but this sleazy action flick is only fun with the guys over on a Friday movie/pizza night. It doesn't have any other value than that.
A hot topic but a poorly done Kung Fu movie.  Must have been financed by some rich Thai wannabes.  The story deals with young girls being sold or kidnapped for sex slaves.
